backlog.name: Field Conditions UX audit
backlog.notes: Sunlight contrast, glove-sized tap targets, offline mode, one-handed use
backlog.detail:
Optimise for real rigger working conditions:
• Bright sunlight — high contrast mode, increased text weight
• Thick gloves — all tap targets min 60-72px, no precision gestures
• Offline/patchy signal — queue writes locally, sync on reconnect
• Wind, rain, wet screen — large buttons, voice input primary, no swipe gestures

Priority area: inspection capture flow (FindingForm, observation entry, photo capture)

tasks.name: E2E: run complete lifecycle test
tasks.notes: Customer → boat → inspection → PDF → job → invoice
tasks.detail:
Walk through the entire RigMate lifecycle as a rigger would. Create real test data, not dummy placeholders.

1. Create customer (real name, contact)
2. Add boat (real vessel details)
3. Start inspection → dictate findings → complete
4. Generate PDF report
5. Create job from inspection
6. Generate quote
7. Complete job → generate invoice

Document every friction point, bug, and missing feature encountered.

tasks.name: Define ERP v1 scope boundaries
tasks.notes: Based on E2E findings — what stays, what's deferred
tasks.detail:
After running the E2E test, decide what's v1-essential vs deferrable:

• Customer + Boat — essential
• Inspection + Dictation + PDF — essential
• Job creation — essential
• Invoice — essential
• Quoting — essential or do riggers just do the work and invoice?
• Customer Portal — nice-to-have or essential?
• Scheduling — nice-to-have or essential?

Output: a clear v1 feature list that gets deployed Monday.
